Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly early patterned pottery chalice with part of cul; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky dark brown; exterior: faint trace of brown line at top of cul; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The accentuated curve of the cul and the lack of decoration suggest that the sherd belongs early in the series.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0344) (phase 2)
